posts.name: SAKSHI PATHAK
Carlton D'Silva
posts.cooked:
Hi Sakshi,
The error is quite clear, it cannot find the file /data/contacts.json
Question: What creates the /data/contacts.json file?

posts.name: SAKSHI PATHAK
posts.cooked: so how to do it sir that the thing i am not able to understand.

posts.name: SAKSHI PATHAK
posts.cooked:
sir kindly help me with this the time is running and i am still at the starting stage of project.
@carlton

posts.name: Saransh Saini
posts.cooked: Sakshi as the error says it’s unable to find your file. Try adding a . (dot) before the location.

posts.name: SAKSHI PATHAK
posts.cooked: sir i have used the dot(.) while sending the request to postman in the query which i provided to the task. Is the dot(.) should be added somewhere else?

posts.name: Saransh Saini
posts.cooked: If you have added that dot as a prefix to your locations then, you would have to structure your query_gpt in such a way that it takes these dots into consideration.

posts.name: SAKSHI PATHAK
Ansh bansal
posts.cooked: have you first post a request for task A1 as it creates the data folder along with  all the other files .

posts.name: SAKSHI PATHAK
posts.cooked: no actually do we have to create another file for that or we have to request post in this one ? can you guide me for that step wise . it would be very helpful.

posts.name: Ansh bansal
posts.cooked: by running task A1 , it automatically creates a data folder along with all the files in it. Without running task A1 you can’t do rest of A tasks

posts.name: SAKSHI PATHAK
posts.cooked: how can i run A1 task can elaborate a little bit. do i have to create data folder manually or  using this code by giving query taskA1 it will generate that folder ?

posts.name: Ansh bansal
posts.cooked:
simply give task=“task”
task: copy the task a_1 from project document
